column3: "The proper time at which an objection of the nature should be taken

column2: is  before the accused has pleaded"

It 
is  well  settled  law 
that  if a  charge  sheet  is  defective,  objection  to
charge sheet must be raised at the very inception."

column3: In light  of above,  it  is  understood  that  a party  is  not allowed  to  raise  an  objection
with regard  to  a defect in the charge sheet at a belated point of time.  The appellant

column2: should  have  raised  this  objection  as  early  as  possible.  This  Court  has  held

column3: numerous  occasions  that  it  would  be  absurd  to  allow  an  appellant  in  a  vehicle

column2: confiscation case to stand on the ground of defective charge, at the stage of appeal.

to 
I  am  of  the  view  that  above  said  defect  was  not  material

column3: especially  given  the  fact  that the  accused  pleaded  guilty to the  charge.  Therefore,

column2: the 3rd  ground of appeal too should fail.

column3: Considering above,  I see no reason to  interfere with the  order of the Learned High

column2: Court Judge of Kurunegala. Therefore, I affmn the same.
Accordingly, the appeal  is hereby dismissed without costs.
